review_title: a small cog in a very large machine
pros:
The campus and facilities are beautiful. 
Sport and active lifestyles abound. 
Benefits are good.
Free MAX pass was a great perk (trying to find parking on campus was a chore).
Tuition reimbursement program was a great perk for continuing education. 
Great food offerings at cafeterias.
cons:
Work is often repetitive. 
There's so much competition for roles, it's hard to get promoted internally. 
With it being such a huge corporation, positions tend to be highly specialized and narrow. So if you need variety in your work, this might not be the best place. 
Super cliquey, run by the "popular kids". 
Toxic white male leadership abounds.

review_title: Good Colleagues but Culture Very Much Like High School
pros: Terrific people to work with and learn from--always plenty of opportunity to learn and grow and extraordinary talent showing great passion for doing good work and being a positive force.
cons: Bro culture that emphasizes cliques, jock behavior and "in crowd" status over delivered results is a business weakness. Individuals who talk a good game or get protection from a powerful-enough executive will do just fine; if you hope to succeed based on delivering positive business results yourself--you're probably in the wrong company. I was advised by a senior leader to "be the fun little sister" in order to succeed. Sigh.... Some talk is happening about addressing this cultural problem, but it's built into the DNA of the company and will be hard to overcome. For many poc and women, it's an uphill climb.

They also paid during shut down for COVID. Despite some of the cons, it was a cool place to work for the time being, but definitely would only do it as a once or twice a week job.
cons: Might have just been overstaffing mistakes due to customer limits, but we always had WAY too many staff. At one point there was one employee per customer. Very strict on talking during shifts and not lenient on any kind of lateness, be it 2 mins or 20 mins (lots of employees fired for lateness).

review_title: Culture seems to be changing, unfortunately
pros: Can be great culture if you're in a good group. Good pay and benefits.
cons:
Can also be terrible culture if you're in the wrong group. And in general, the culture is shifting for the worse. Used to be a place you could work hard and build a career - now it's place that they expect you to be happy to have your job, and regardless of your performance, your role can be eliminated at any point. No longer a place to grow, and be part of building something - rather just a place to survive as long as you can (and for some people do whatever you need to in order to survive). 

Too bad - used to be great.
